titleStmt.title: A full account of the late ship-wreck of the ship called The President which was cast away in Montz-Bay in Cornwal on the 4th of February last as it was delivered to His Majesty (both in writing and discourse) / by William Smith and John Harshfield, the only persons that escaped in the said wreck ; together with all the remarkable adventures in the said voyage from their sailing out of the Sound of Plimouth, on May Day, 1682, particularly their engagement with six pirate-ships at once on the coast of Malabar ; the whole relation being taken in private conference with the said William Smith.
titleStmt.author: Smith, William.
Harshfield, John.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
